Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Camille L. Velez- Rive:Preliminary/Bail as to Jeffrey Cummings-Avila held on 5/14/2012. Present are AUSA Cesar Rivera and AFPD Thomas Cosgrove. The Government called to the witness stand FBI SA Paul Allen. Direct and cross-examination conduted. Exhibits 1 through 3 (pictures of drugs seized) were presented and admitted into evidence. After hearing the witness’ testimony and the arguments from the parties, the Court made a finding of probable cause and the defendant is held to answer to a Grand Jury of this District. As to bail, AFPD Cosgrove stated that at this time they had nothing to offer, but reserved the right to reopen hearing. The Court ordered defendant detained without bail. Order to issue. (Court Reporter -FTR.)Interpreter -Enith Valdez. (yr) [3:12-mj-00650- CVR] (Entered: 05/16/2012)

Minute for proceedings held before Judge Jose A Fuste: Status Conference as to Jeffrey Cummings-Avila held on 7/26/2012. Present: SAUSA Cesar Rivera, Atty. Jorge Armenteros. Regarding dkt. 24 Motion requesting additional discovery, SAUSA Rivera stated that the information is available, but disclosure will depend on the ruling in reference to dkt. 25 Motion to inquire into source of attorney fees. Ex-parte sidebar held between the Government and the Court re dkt. 25 . Afterwards, Atty. Armenteros joined the sidebar conference. The Court ordered the Government to file a motion by 8/2/2012 re potential conflict of interest. Motion due by 8/2/2012. Response to Motion Deadline due by 8/8/2012. Motion Hearing set for 8/9/2012 05:30 PM in Courtroom 7 before Judge Jose A Fuste. Dkt. 26 Motion requesting consolidation of proceedings and to continue status conference was also discussed and noted by the Court. Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Marcos E. Lopez: Initial Appearance as to Christopher L. Laureano-Perez(2), Rambert Torres-Santiago(10), Hector J. Garcia-Maestre(13), Hector M. Garcia-Maestre(15), Jean Carlos Semprit- Perez(16), Antero Rivera-Marrero(18) held on 11/29/2012. Present: AUSA Alberto Lopez and USPTS Carolina Aparicio. Govt. requested Indictment to be unsealed. Court grants request. Defendants were provided with copy of the Indictment and advised as to the charges and their rights. After reviewing the CJA-23 forms filled by defendants, the Court deemed it appropriate to appoint counsel. As to Defendant Antero Rivera-Marrero (18), defendant shall retain counsel. The remainder defendant will be represented by CJA counsel. Defendant ordered temporarily detained. Arraignment/Detention set for 12/4/2012 at 1:30 PM in Courtroom 10 before US Magistrate Judge Marcos E. Lopez. (amr) (Entered: 11/30/2012)

ORDER denying 186 Motion Requesting Order as to Christopher L. Laureano-Perez (2). More than thirty years have elapsed since the decision in Cobb. Nowadays, we have video conferencing and telephone facilities that allow counsel to have lengthy face-to- face discussions with a client. Also, if needed, counsel can be authorized to travel to Georgia or the defendant may be brought back for legitimate reasons. At this time, the court is not in a position to decide that a transfer for valid reasons impinges on Sixth Amendment rights. Signed by Judge Jose A Fuste on 12/14/2012. (mrj) (Entered: 12/14/2012)

Defendant is U/C and present in court. 315 Motion for DeNovo Hearing as to Antero Rivera-Marrero (18) was discussed. The Government proffered the evidence against the defendant. Attorney Aguayo replied. The defendant has no criminal history, possess a license for the firearms and during the intervention the firearm was unloaded. Arguments heard by all parties. The Court adopted the recommendation of the Pretrial Office and set bail in the amount of $100,000 cash or secured with real property, curfew with electronic monitoring, will be allowed to work from 6 AM to 7 PM, plus standard conditions of release. Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Bruce J. McGiverin: Arraignment/Detention Hearing as to Josue B. Ascencio-Vega (3) was held on 5/9/2013. Present: AUSA Cesar Rivera, Atty Jorge Vega-Pacheco. Deft was found competent to understand the proceedings. He waived the reading of the Indictment and entered a plea of not guilty as to all applicable counts. The parties will have 7 days for discovery and 14 days thereafter to file any motions. Case is referred to Judge Jose A. Fuste for trial setting. As to bail, defense counsel informed that they had nothing to offer. The Court ordered deft detained without bail. Order to issue. Defense counsel asked the Court to please note that although the case is set for an upcoming trial as to other defts, due to deft 3's recent arrest, defense counsel is not prepared to go to trial at this time. A motion to continue or sever trial date shall be filed. (Court Reporter FTR, Interpreter Enith Valdes) (Hearing was set for 9:00 a.m., held at 9:50-9:57 a.m.) (mc) (Entered: 05/14/2013)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before Judge Jose A. Fuste: Sentencing held on 12/6/2013 for Josue B. Ascencio-Vega (3). Present: AUSA Cesar Rivera, Atty. Jorge Vega-Pacheco, USPO Deni Rodriguez. Minute Entry for proceedings held before Judge Jose A. Fuste in Cr. Cases 12-00426- 004 (JAF) and 14-00476-001 (JAF): Sentencing held on 1/15/2015 for Jonathan Milan- Rodriguez (4). Present: AUSA Cesar Rivera, Atty. Laura Maldonado, USPO Merangelie Serrano. Defendant is U/C and present in court. Statements in support of mitigation of punishment heard on behalf of the defense. Defendant's allocution heard. The Court noted that the PSR already takes into consideration Amendment 782. Counts were grouped together for sentencing guidelines calculations. Defendant was sentenced to an IMPR term of 168 months as to each count to be served concurrently to each other; SRT of 10 yrs as to Ct. 7 in Cr. Case 12-426 and 3 yrs as to Ct. 1 in Cr. Case 14-476 to be served concurrently to each other; SMA of $200.00; Count 9 in Cr. Case 12-426 is dismissed. Defendant requested a reconsideration. AUSA Rivera replied. Denied. (Court Reporter Amy Walker.)Hearing set for 09:30.Hearing held at 09:35.Hearing ended at 10:13.Interpreter Felix Toledo. (dv) (Entered: 01/20/2015)

JUDGMENT as to Jonathan Milan-Rodriguez (4), IMPR for 168 months as to each count to be served concurrently to each other; SRT of 10 yrs as to Ct. 7 in Cr. Case 12- 426 and 3 yrs as to Ct. 1 in Cr. Case 14-476 to be served concurrently to each other; SMA of $200.00. Signed by Judge Jose A. Fuste on 01/15/2015.(dv) (Entered: 01/20/2015)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before Judge Jose A. Fuste: Re-sentencing as to Christopher L. Laureano-Perez (2) held on 1/8/2016. Present: AUSA Cesar Rivera; Atty. Osvaldo Carlo, USPO Ariel Rivera (arrived at 2:13 PM). Defendant is U/C, present in court and is being assisted by the Court Interpreter. Case was remanded by the Court of Appeals for re-sentencing. Defendant's request for a new attorney was denied by the Court. Allocution heard. Statements in support of mitigation of punishment heard on behalf of the defense. Counts were grouped for guideline calculation purposes. Counts 7,9, IMPR for 480 months as to Ct. 7 and 240 months as to Ct. 9 to be served concurrently to each other; SRT of 5 years as to Ct. 7 and 3 years as to Ct. 9 to be served concurrently to each other; SMA of $200.00. Defendant was advised of his right to appeal. Exhibits admitted: Court's 1, Defendant's 1. (Court Reporter Amy Walker.)Hearing set for 01:30.Hearing held at 02:00.Hearing ended at 02:40.Interpreter Sonia Crescioni. (dv) Modified on 1/15/2016 to add dkt text as to exhibits admitted (mr). (Entered: 01/15/2016)

ORDER as to Juan B. Reyes-Bonilla (20): Defendant has moved the court to grant him sentencing relief under Amendment 782 to the Sentencing Guidelines. (ECF No. 1245 .) The court initially denied him relief at ECF No. 1427 , but we have now reconsidered our decision. At the moment, however, the court lacks authority to grant defendant relief because an appeal of his judgment of conviction has been docketed and is pending. Accordingly, under Federal Rule of Appellate Procedure 12.1(a), the court hereby indicates to the Court of Appeals that we would grant defendant the requested sentencing relief if the case were remanded to us. Signed by Judge Jose A. Fuste on 2/8/2016.(mrj) (Entered: 02/08/2016)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before Chief Judge Aida M. Delgado-Colon: Re- sentencing as to Jonathan Milan-Rodriguez (4) held on 7/18/2016. Present: AUSA Victor Acevedo and defense counsel Laura Maldonado. Defendant is present, under custody and assisted by the Court Interpreter. USPO Merangelie Serrano also present. Statements in support of mitigation of punishment heard on behalf of the defense. Defendant's allocution heard. Government stands by the sentence recommendation contained within the plea agreement. Has no objection to the request that the term of imprisonment to be imposed be served concurrently with CR. 14-476 (ADC). The Court  imposed a term of 12 months and 1 day as to Count 1 in CR. 14-476 to be served concurrently with the 168 months imposed as to Count 7 in CR. 12-426-04 (ADC). SRT of 3 years to be served concurrently with the SRT of 3 years imposed in CR. 14-476. SRT conditions imposed on 1/15/2015 shall remain in effect. No fine. SMA of $100.00 imposed as to each count. (Court Reporter Diane Breaz.) Hearing set for 2:30 p.m. Hearing held at 3:20 p.m. Hearing ended at 4:00 p.m. Interpreter Janis Palma. (sr) (Entered: 07/19/2016)

ORDER are 1616 Motion to Continue filed by Angel Matos- Velez (40). Personnel by the FPD has been requested, in numerous occasions, not only to be diligent, but also to be conscious of the court's need to effectively use its complete calendar. This case was set on 3/20/2017, for a hearing on 5/3/2017. Judge Gelpi did set his trial on 3/13/2017  (to begin in 4/18/2017). This, the FPD has had over a month to identify the calendar conflict, to alert the Court in a timely fashion (not on the date of the hearing at 8:41 a.m.) or re-assign the case to another AFPD. As such the delayed and untimely request, is DENIED. Signed by Chief Judge Aida M. Delgado-Colon on 5/3/2017.(wm) (Entered: 05/03/2017)

ORDER as to Jaime Vigil-De-Jesus (41) re 1656 Motion for Disclosure. Defendant points that no discovery has been provided as to this revocation proceedings. It is noted that the initial motion for revocation was filed on 12/4/17 and while a motion to continue the revocation hearing was filed on 2/20/2018, no discovery was ever requested until 2/22/18 when the instant motion was filed. Neither was discovery requested prior to the preliminary revocation hearing held on January 17, 2018, wherein defendant waived the same. Nonetheless, the discovery request is Granted. The USPO is to ensure that disclosures do not jeopardize the safety of third parties. Under such scenarios arrangements may be done for in-chambers inspection or disclosures. Signed by Chief Judge Aida M. Delgado-Colon on 3/1/18.(wm) (Entered: 03/06/2018)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Camille L. Velez- Rive:Initial Appearance re Revocation of Supervised Release as to Abdiel Arocho- Vazquez (27) held on 1/27/2020. Present were AFPD Laura Soto and USPO Celymar Berrios. Defendant was brought before this Court through an arrest warrant issued. Prior to commencing the initial, the parties met with the Court in chambers to discuss the particularities of this case and the need for defendant to faithfully comply with the medication he was prescribed in the treatment center for his desintoxication. The Court address defendant and advised him that he was going to be released to his family, who was present in Court, and he would continue under the same conditions of release previously imposed, including electronic monitoring; but that one more deviation from the same would entail incarceration. The Court also urged defendant to faithfully comply with the instructions given so that he could regain his health, which would aid him in his final revocation hearing, if probable cause is found at the time of the next hearing. Defendant will be released today. Preliminary Revocation Hearing set for 2/6/2020 at 09:00 AM in Courtroom 11 before US Magistrate Judge Camille L. Velez-Rive. Minute Entry for proceedings held before Judge Aida M. Delgado-Colon:Final Hearing re Revocation of Supervised Release as to John Vadis-Rivera (28) held on 6/3/2020 by VTC. Present: AUSA Jeanette Collazo and AFPD Lauren Rosen. Defendant present, under custody, and assisted by the Court Interpreter. USPO Helga Maldonado also present.The record should reflect the proceedings are being held by VTC, given the emergency situation created by the COVID-19 pandemic. Therefore, the defendant has consented to proceed by VTC, and defendant has secured a waiver to that effect that appears on the record. The interpreter is acting and assisting the defendant on a secured line, as well, at MDC-Guaynabo and we have a clear view of him on screen. Defense informed they will not contest the violations, as so informed by the Supervising US Probation Officer. Statements in support of mitigation of punishment heard on behalf of the defense, requested an imprisonment term of twelve months and one day. Defendant's allocution heard. Government stood by the recommendation contained within the joint motion, SRT be revoked and an imprisonment term of 12 months and 1 day be imposed along with further supervision. SRT revoked. IMPR: 12 months and | day. SRT of 6 years. Defense moved for reconsideration that time served be imposed. Defendant has already served over 10 months, and due to the COVID-19 emergency, this will afford his immediate release, instead of BOP having to ascertain a release date. Reconsideration Granted. An imprisonment term of time served was imposed. SRT of 6 years remains in place. (Court Reporter Rachelle Robinson-Ware.) Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Camille L. Velez-Rive: Initial Appearance re Revocation of Supervised Release as to Jonathan Andino-Serrano (43) held via VTC on 2/25/2021. Present were AUSA Ginette Milanes and AFPD Cherelle Herbert. The defendant was under custody, present by video and assisted by the Court Interpreter. He voluntarily waived the right to be physically present at the hearing and consented to proceed via VTC. The defendant was advised as to alleged violations contained in 1935 Motion Notifying Violations to Supervised Release Term filed by USPO Fernandez and as to his rights. The Court deemed it appropriate to appoint counsel. The defendant shall be represented by the Federal Public Defender. Pursuant to the Due Process Protections Act, the Court ordered the United States to disclose in a timely manner all exculpatory evidence to the defendant[s] pursuant to Brady v. Maryland, 373 U.S. 83 (1963) and its progeny. Failure to comply with this order may result in consequences, including, but not limited to, the reversal of any conviction, the exclusion of evidence, adverse jury instructions, dismissal of charges, contempt proceedings, disciplinary action, and/or sanctions by the Court. The Court ordered the defendant temporarily detained pending further proceedings. Preliminary Revocation Hearing is set for 3/8/2021 at 11:00 AM via VTC Bridge before US Magistrate Judge Camille L. Velez-Rive. (Court Reporter ZOOM.) Hearing set for 3:30 PM. Hearing held at 3:30 PM. Hearing ended at 3:34 PM. Interpreter Ani Navarro. (cmd) (Entered: 02/26/2021)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Camille L. Velez-Rive: Case called for Preliminary Revocation Hearing as to Jonathan Andino-Serrano (43) held via VTC on 3/11/2021. Present were AUSA Alexander Alum, AFPD Isabel Mattina and USPO Mariel Fernandez. The defendant was under custody, present by telephone and assisted by the Court Interpreter. The defendant voluntarily waived his right to be physically present at the hearing and consented to proceed via telephone since he is currently quarantined in the isolation unit and no video is available. Defense counsel argued in favor of conditions of release pending the final revocation hearing. The Government did not oppose. After having heard the parties, the Court ordered that the defendant be release under the conditions of release previously imposed with the added conditions of home incarceration and the wearing of a location monitoring device with GPS technology. Modifications to these conditions may be considered depending on the outcome of the state court hearing. Defense counsel shall inform via motion. The defendant is not entitled to a preliminary revocation hearing under Fed.R.Crim.P. 32.1. Accordingly, the preliminary revocation hearing before the undersigned is vacated. This matter is referred to the presiding District Judge for the final revocation hearing. (Court Reporter ZOOM.) Hearing set for 9:30 AM. Hearing held at 9:30 AM. Hearing ended at 10:08 AM. Interpreter Mary Jo Smith. (cmd) (Entered: 03/11/2021)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before U.S. District Judge Francisco A. Besosa as to Heclouis Nieves-Diaz (35) for Revocation on Supervised Release held on June 22, 2021. Present via VTC AUSA Jeanette M. Collazo, and AFPD Ivan Santos-Castaldo. USPO Ivelisse Alonso also present. The defendant was present, under custody and assisted by certified court interpreter Sonia Crescioni. The defendant waived the hearing and accepted the violations of the conditions of supervised release as stated by the U.S. Probation Office at ECF No. 1902. Counsel for defendant requested a term of 12 months to be served concurrently with the term imposed in Cr. 20-353-01 (FAB). The United States requested a term of 12 months to be served consecutively with the term imposed in Cr. 20-353-01 (FAB). Defendant refused to allocute. After having heard the parties, the Court made a finding that defendant Heclouis Joel Nieves-Diaz (35) has violated the conditions of the supervised release term imposed on him by engaging in new criminal conduct, to wit: Prohibited Person in Possession of Ammunition: Felon, Illegal Possession of a Machinegun, and Possession with the Intent to Distribute Controlled Substance: Cocaine, as indicated in the motion filed by the Probation Officer at ECF No. 1902. Supervised release term imposed on May 15, 2020 was revoked. The Court imposed an Imprisonment of 18 months to be served consecutively to the sentence imposed in Cr. 20-353-01 (FAB) with no further supervision to follow. All terms and conditions are specified in the judgment of revocation form. The defendant was advised as to his right to appeal, etc. (Court Reporter Rachel Robinson-Ware.)Hearing set for 10:00. Hearing held at 11:23.Hearing ended at 11:32.Interpreter Sonia Crescioni. USPO Ivelisse Alonso (om) (Entered: 06/24/2021)

JUDGMENT ON REVOCATION as to Heclouis Nieves-Diaz (35). Impr of 18 months to be served consecutively to the sentence imposed in Cr. 20-353-01 (FAB) with no further supervision to follow. Signed by Judge Francisco A. Besosa on 6/22/2021.(om) (Entered: 06/24/2021)
